results.title: Mr Fixit - my dad
results.creator_credit: Michael Thornhill, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A film to provoke discussion. With his son facing a drug charge from smoking marijuana, a father is faced with a dilemma: should he let events take their course or should he attempt to get his son off the hook? Cast: James Condon, Jessica Noad, Tony O’Malley Jones. Cinematography by Russell Boyd. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Mr Europe and the common market
results.creator_credit: William K McClure, Carousel Films and Columbia Broadcasting System
results.brief_description: Summarises the economic changes in Western Europe today. Shows the costly difficulties encountered by a truckload of goods from Manchester, England, before it arrives at its destination in Italy. Shows how the common market breaks down barriers, and benefits participating countries. Interviews Jean Monnet, “Mr Europe” and other businessmen involved in the common market.

results.title: Mr Chairman: fundamentals of parliamentary law
results.brief_description: Presents the fundamentals of parliamentary law in a series of dramatic animated sequences. Shows why rules of order are essential to the processes of democratic discussion and decision-making, and suggests ways in which parliamentary procedures can be adapted to the specific needs of a group, whatever its size or objective.

results.title: Mr and Mrs Robin's family
results.brief_description: Shows a nesting family of robins from spring to autumn. Mrs Robin builds a nest of grass and twigs in a pine tree. Four eggs hatch out, and feeding the fledglings is a full-time job for the parents. Before winter finds them migrating south, the robins rear a second family. Suitable for primary level.

results.title: Mozzie [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Dylan Yeo, Jane Keneally and AFTRS
results.brief_description: As a man tries to sleep two animated mosquitoes buzz around him, attending to the business of blood sucking and fending off insect repellent in the process. A short film that effectively mixes live action with computer animation to convey the themes of global warming, the effect of chloro fluorocarbons and alternative therapy in brain surgery.

results.title: Mozart in Delphi
results.creator_credit: Don Philps and Robert L Allnutt
results.brief_description: This is a film of a journey to the source of Western civilisation in the ruins of the historical site at Delphi. The music of the Classic Greeks has not survived but in the form and harmony of Mozart’s music the Apollonian concepts are given complete expression. In 1985, the Australian Chamber Orchestra travelled to Greece to perform in Athens and at Delphi as part of the Cultural Capital of Europe Festival 1985 to honour this classic heritage. Rated: G

results.title: Moving wool
results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows modern methods of wool handling, from shearing and grading, to baling and shipping. Technical advances have enabled improvements in wool processing. New ideas and approaches could lead to increased efficiency and quality in packaging and transportation of wool. Emphasises the importance of wool to Australia. Suitable for upper primary and secondary levels.

results.title: Moving things on land
results.brief_description: Shows two boys faced with the task of shifting a large box of comics. Describes friction, its usefulness, and the various means that have been devised for reducing it when undesirable. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Moving statics
results.brief_description: An attempt to transfer the abstract kinetic art of the Dutch mime, Will Spoor, to the screen, using techniques of animation, superimposition, and film speed and exposure changes to create new patterns of body movement. Made in London, 1969. Commentary by Will Spoor.

results.title: Moving pictures: the art of Jan Lenica
results.creator_credit: Richard Rogers, Robert Gardner and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Gives insight into the patience, care and concentration that allows Lenica to conquer the processes of animating his pictures. Shows Lenica at work on “Landscapes” at Harvard and explores the relationship of the artist with his “real” world at the moments when he conjures his fantasy visions.
